data.why:
I've written a module called Config::Objective. It's Yet Another
    config file parsing module, but unlike most of the existing
    Config::* modules, which represent config data as simple variables,
    Config::Objective represents config data as perl objects. This
    allows for a much more flexible configuration language, since new
    classes can be easily written to add methods to the config syntax.

    The module uses Parse::Lex and Parse::Yapp for the config parsing
    itself.

meta.subject: PAUSE ID request (ROTH; Mark D. Roth)
